model.Exo_analytics.int_locations.raw_sql:
WITH locations AS (
  SELECT 
    location_id,
    tms_city,
    tms_state,
    tms_country,
    tms_geom
  FROM
    {{ ref('stg_locations') }}  
),

census_places AS (
  SELECT
    state,
    place_id,
    place_name,
    geom
  FROM
    {{ ref('stg_census_places') }}
),

nearest_cities AS (
SELECT
  l.location_id,
  ARRAY_AGG(STRUCT(c.place_id AS id,
      c.place_name AS name,
      c.state AS state,
      c.geom AS geom,
      ROUND(ST_Distance(l.tms_geom, c.geom)/1609.34, 2) AS dist_miles)
  ORDER BY
    ST_Distance(l.tms_geom, c.geom)
  LIMIT 1
  ) [ORDINAL(1)] AS place
FROM
  locations l
JOIN
  census_places c
ON
  ST_DWithin(l.tms_geom, c.geom, 30000)
--WHERE c.name_lsad LIKE "%city%"
GROUP BY
  l.location_id)

SELECT
  location_id,
  tms_city,
  tms_state,
  tms_country,
  tms_geom,
  place.id AS census_id,
  place.name AS census_city,
  place.state AS census_state,
  place.geom AS census_geom,
  place.dist_miles
FROM 
  locations
JOIN
  nearest_cities
USING
  (location_id)

model.Exo_analytics.stg_loads.raw_sql:
WITH
  tms_loads AS (
  SELECT
    *
  FROM
    {{ source('tms','loads') }} 
)

SELECT
  id AS load_id,
  shipper_id AS shp_id,
  consignee_id AS csg_id,
  carrier_id,
  equipment_type,
  {{ equip_cat('equipment_type') }} AS equipment_category,
  date_created AS created_at,
  updated_at,
  booked_date AS booked_at,
  NULLIF(carrier_price, 0) AS carrier_price,
  NULLIF(customer_price, 0) AS customer_price,
  COALESCE(fuel_surcharge, 0) AS fuel_surcharge,
  NULLIF(miles, 0) AS mileage
FROM
  tms_loads
WHERE
  booked_date > '2020-01-01'
  AND NOT archived
  AND carrier_id IS NOT NULL
model.Exo_analytics.stg_loads.name: stg_loads
model.Exo_analytics.stg_loads.compiled_sql:
WITH
  tms_loads AS (
  SELECT
    *
  FROM
    EXTERNAL_QUERY("potrtms.us.potr-tms-prod", "SELECT * FROM loads_load") 
)

SELECT
  id AS load_id,
  shipper_id AS shp_id,
  consignee_id AS csg_id,
  carrier_id,
  equipment_type,
  (CASE 
    WHEN equipment_type IN ('Removable Gooseneck', 'Double Drop') THEN 'Open Deck Specialized'
    WHEN equipment_type IN ('Van', 'Van or Reefer', 'Flatbed Step Deck or Van') THEN 'Van'
    WHEN equipment_type IN ('Reefer', 'Reef') THEN 'Reefer'
    WHEN equipment_type IN ('Flatbed', 'Conestoga', 'Step Deck', 'Flatbed or Step Deck') THEN 'Open Deck'
    WHEN equipment_type IN ('Power Only', 'Power O') THEN 'Power Only'
    ELSE 'Others'
  END) AS equipment_category,
  date_created AS created_at,
  updated_at,
  booked_date AS booked_at,
  NULLIF(carrier_price, 0) AS carrier_price,
  NULLIF(customer_price, 0) AS customer_price,
  COALESCE(fuel_surcharge, 0) AS fuel_surcharge,
  NULLIF(miles, 0) AS mileage
FROM
  tms_loads
WHERE
  booked_date > '2020-01-01'
  AND NOT archived
  AND carrier_id IS NOT NULL

model.Exo_analytics.stg_census_places.raw_sql:
WITH
  census_places AS (
  SELECT
    *
  FROM
    {{ source('geo_us_census_places', 'us_national_places') }} ),

  states AS (
  SELECT
    *
  FROM
    {{ source('geo_us_boundaries', 'states') }} )
    
SELECT
  s.state,
  c.place_id,
  c.place_name,
  c.place_geom AS geom
FROM
  census_places c
JOIN
  states s
USING
  (state_fips_code)
WHERE
  name_lsad NOT LIKE "%CDP%"

model.Exo_analytics.fct_loads.raw_sql:
WITH loads AS (
  SELECT
    load_id,
    shp_id,
    csg_id,
    carrier_id,
    equipment_type,
    equipment_category,
    created_at,
    updated_at,
    booked_at,
    carrier_price,
    customer_price,
    fuel_surcharge,
    mileage
  FROM
    {{ ref('stg_loads') }}
  ),
locations AS (
  SELECT
    location_id,
    census_city,
    census_state,
    tms_geom
  FROM
    {{ ref('int_locations') }} 
  )

SELECT
  loads.shp_id,
  loads.csg_id,
  loads.carrier_id,
  loads.load_id,
  loads.equipment_type,
  loads.equipment_category,
  loads.created_at,
  loads.booked_at,
  loads.carrier_price,
  loads.customer_price,
  loads.fuel_surcharge,
  loads.mileage,
  ((loads.customer_price+loads.fuel_surcharge) - loads.carrier_price) AS profit,
  ((loads.customer_price+loads.fuel_surcharge)/loads.mileage) AS customer_rate,
  (loads.carrier_price/loads.mileage) AS carrier_rate,
  (((loads.customer_price+loads.fuel_surcharge) - loads.carrier_price)/loads.mileage) AS profit_rate,
  (((loads.customer_price+loads.fuel_surcharge) - loads.carrier_price)/loads.customer_price) AS margin_pct,
  shp.census_city AS shp_city,
  shp.census_state AS shp_state,
  shp.tms_geom AS shp_geom,
  csg.census_city AS csg_city,
  csg.census_state AS csg_state,
  csg.tms_geom AS csg_geom
FROM
  loads
JOIN
  locations AS shp --shipper
ON
  loads.shp_id = shp.location_id
JOIN
  locations AS csg --consignee
ON
  loads.csg_id = csg.location_id

WITH int_locations AS (
    SELECT
        location_id,
        tms_city,
        tms_state,
        tms_country,
        census_id,
        census_city,
        census_state,
        dist_miles
    FROM
        {{ ref('int_locations') }}
)

SELECT
    COUNT(*) AS total,
    SUM(CASE WHEN tms_city IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS null_tms_city,
    SUM(CASE WHEN tms_state IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS null_tms_state,
    SUM(CASE WHEN census_city IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS null_census_city,
    SUM(CASE WHEN census_state IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS null_census_state,
    SUM(CASE WHEN tms_city != census_city THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS dif_city,
    SUM(CASE WHEN tms_state != census_state THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS dif_state
FROM
    int_locations

test.Exo_analytics.assert_tms_geom_is_in.raw_sql:
{{ config(severity = 'warn') }}

WITH locations AS (
  SELECT
    id AS location_id,
    INITCAP(city) AS tms_city,
    UPPER(state_province_region) AS tms_state,
    ST_GEOGFROMWKB(geo_point) AS tms_geom
  FROM
    {{ source('tms', 'locations') }} 
),

states AS (
  SELECT
    state,
    state_geom
  FROM
    {{ source('geo_us_boundaries', 'states') }}  
)

SELECT
  tms_city,
  tms_state,
  state AS within_state,
  ANY_VALUE(tms_geom) AS tms_geom
FROM
  locations
JOIN
  states
ON
  ST_WITHIN(tms_geom, state_geom)
GROUP BY
  1, 2, 3
HAVING
  NOT (tms_state = state)

analysis.Exo_analytics.legacy_script.raw_sql:
--replace null mileage with avg of the exact same lane
UPDATE
  `potrtms.regions.loads_locations` ll
SET
  miles = avg_miles
FROM (
  SELECT
    shipper_census_city,
    shipper_census_state,
    consignee_census_city,
    consignee_census_state,
    AVG(miles) AS avg_miles
  FROM
    `potrtms.regions.loads_locations`
  GROUP BY
    shipper_census_city,
    shipper_census_state,
    consignee_census_city,
    consignee_census_state) am
WHERE
  ll.shipper_census_city = am.shipper_census_city
  AND ll.shipper_census_state = am.shipper_census_state
  AND ll.consignee_census_city = am.consignee_census_city
  AND ll.consignee_census_state = am.consignee_census_state
  AND ll.miles IS NULL 
;
UPDATE
  `potrtms.regions.loads_locations`
SET
  customer_rate =((customer_price+fuel_surcharge)/miles),
  carrier_rate = (carrier_price/miles),
  profit_rate = (((customer_price+fuel_surcharge) - carrier_price)/miles)
WHERE
  TRUE 
;
 --Define density based spatial clusters over shipper and consignee data. Mininimum points per cluster = 1. Maximum distance between clusters points: 75/100km (45/60 miles)
  CREATE TEMPORARY TABLE voronoi_shipper AS (
  WITH
    shipper_clusters AS (
    SELECT
      load_id,
      shipper_geom,
      ST_CLUSTERDBSCAN(shipper_geom,
        1e5,
        1) OVER () AS cluster_num
    FROM
      `potrtms.regions.loads_locations`
    WHERE
      shipper_geom IS NOT NULL ),

    shipper_centroids AS(
    SELECT
      cluster_num,
      ARRAY_AGG(load_id) AS rowids,
      ST_Centroid(ST_UNION_AGG(shipper_geom)) AS cgeom
    FROM
      shipper_clusters
    GROUP BY
      cluster_num ),
    shipper_array_centroids AS (
    SELECT
      ARRAY (
      SELECT
        cgeom
      FROM
        shipper_centroids) AS ageom ),

    shipper_voronoi_array AS (
    SELECT
      bqcarto.processing.ST_VORONOIPOLYGONS(ageom,
        NULL) AS nested_voronoi
    FROM
      shipper_array_centroids ),
    shipper_voronoi_polygons AS (
    SELECT
      ST_INTERSECTION(aoi.geom,
        unnested_voronoi) AS vor_geom
    FROM
      shipper_voronoi_array,
      UNNEST(nested_voronoi) AS unnested_voronoi,
      `potrtms.regions.aoi` AS aoi )

  SELECT
    cluster_num,
    rowids,
    ST_AREA(vor_geom) AS area,
    vor_geom
  FROM
    shipper_voronoi_polygons
  JOIN
    shipper_centroids
  ON
    ST_Contains(vor_geom,
      cgeom) )
;

ALTER TABLE
  `potrtms.regions.loads_locations` 
ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
  shipper_cid INT64
;

UPDATE
  `potrtms.regions.loads_locations`
SET
  shipper_cid = cluster_num
FROM
  voronoi_shipper
WHERE
  ST_Contains(vor_geom,
    shipper_geom)
;

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS
  `potrtms.regions.dbscan_shipper`
;
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS
  `potrtms.regions.dbscan_shipper` AS (
  SELECT
    shipper_cid AS cid,
    COUNT(load_id) AS loads,
    ROUND(AVG(miles),2) AS mileage,
    ROUND(AVG(carrier_price),2) AS carrier_price,
    ROUND(AVG(customer_price),2) AS customer_price,
    ROUND(AVG(carrier_rate),2) AS carrier_rate,
    ROUND(AVG(customer_rate),2) AS customer_rate,
    ROUND(AVG(profit_rate),2) AS profit_rate,
    ROUND(AVG(margin_pct),2) AS margin,
  FROM
    `potrtms.regions.loads_locations`
  JOIN
    voronoi_shipper
  ON
    shipper_cid = cluster_num
  GROUP BY
    shipper_cid )
;
ALTER TABLE
  `potrtms.regions.dbscan_shipper` 
ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
  geom GEOGRAPHY
;
UPDATE
  `potrtms.regions.dbscan_shipper`
SET
  geom = vor_geom
FROM
  voronoi_shipper
WHERE
  cid = cluster_num
; 
CREATE TEMPORARY TABLE voronoi_consignee AS (
  WITH
    consignee_clusters AS (
    SELECT
      load_id,
      consignee_geom,
      ST_CLUSTERDBSCAN(consignee_geom,
        75000,
        1) OVER () AS cluster_num
    FROM
      `potrtms.regions.loads_locations`
    WHERE
      consignee_geom IS NOT NULL ),

    consignee_centroids AS(
    SELECT
      cluster_num,
      ARRAY_AGG(load_id) AS rowids,
      ST_Centroid(ST_UNION_AGG(consignee_geom)) AS cgeom
    FROM
      consignee_clusters
    GROUP BY
      cluster_num ),

    consignee_array_centroids AS (
    SELECT
      ARRAY (
      SELECT
        cgeom
      FROM
        consignee_centroids) AS ageom ),

    consignee_voronoi_array AS (
    SELECT
      bqcarto.processing.ST_VORONOIPOLYGONS(ageom,
        NULL) AS nested_voronoi
    FROM
      consignee_array_centroids ),

    consignee_voronoi_polygons AS (
    SELECT
      ST_INTERSECTION(aoi.geom,
        unnested_voronoi) AS vor_geom
    FROM
      consignee_voronoi_array,
      UNNEST(nested_voronoi) AS unnested_voronoi,
      `potrtms.regions.aoi` AS aoi )

  SELECT
    cluster_num,
    rowids,
    ST_AREA(vor_geom) AS area,
    vor_geom
  FROM
    consignee_voronoi_polygons
  JOIN
    consignee_centroids
  ON
    ST_Contains(vor_geom,

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS

CREATE TABLE
  `potrtms.regions.wave_shipper` AS
WITH
  shipper_weights AS (
  SELECT
    ea.code,
    ea.name,
    c.cid,
    c.loads,
    (ST_Area(ST_Intersection(c.geom,
          ea.geom)) * c.loads) AS weight
  FROM
    `potrtms.regions.economic_areas` AS ea
  INNER JOIN
    `potrtms.regions.dbscan_shipper` c
  ON
    ST_Intersects(c.geom,
      ea.geom)),

  shipper_weighted_values AS (
  SELECT
    w.code,
    w.name,
    w.cid,
    weight,
    (k.loads * w.weight) AS w_loads,
    (k.mileage * w.weight) AS w_mileage,
    (k.carrier_price * w.weight) AS w_carrier_price,
    (k.customer_price * w.weight) AS w_customer_price,
    (k.carrier_rate * w.weight) AS w_carrier_rate,
    (k.customer_rate * w.weight) AS w_customer_rate,
    (k.profit_rate * w.weight) AS w_profit_rate,
    (k.margin * w.weight) AS w_margin
  FROM
    shipper_weights w
  JOIN
    `potrtms.regions.dbscan_shipper` k
  ON
    k.cid = w.cid)

SELECT
  wv.code,
  wv.name,
  ROUND((SUM(w_loads)/SUM(weight)),0) AS loads,
  ROUND((SUM(w_mileage)/SUM(weight)),2) AS mileage,
  ROUND((SUM(w_carrier_price)/SUM(weight)),2) AS carrier_price,
  ROUND((SUM(w_customer_price)/SUM(weight)),2) AS customer_price,
  ROUND((SUM(w_carrier_rate)/SUM(weight)),2) AS carrier_rate,
  ROUND((SUM(w_customer_rate)/SUM(weight)),2) AS customer_rate,
  ROUND((SUM(w_profit_rate)/SUM(weight)),2) AS profit_rate,
  ROUND((SUM(w_margin)/SUM(weight)),2) AS margin
FROM
  shipper_weighted_values wv
JOIN
  `potrtms.regions.economic_areas` ea
ON
  wv.code = ea.code
GROUP BY
  wv.code,
  wv.name
;

  INNER JOIN
    `potrtms.regions.dbscan_consignee` c
  ON
    ST_Intersects( c.geom,
      ea.geom)),

  consignee_weighted_values AS (
  SELECT
    w.code,
    w.name,
    w.cid,
    weight,
    (k.loads * w.weight) AS w_loads,
    (k.mileage * w.weight) AS w_mileage,
    (k.carrier_price * w.weight) AS w_carrier_price,
    (k.customer_price * w.weight) AS w_customer_price,

  FROM
    consignee_weights w
  JOIN
    `potrtms.regions.dbscan_consignee` k
  ON
    k.cid = w.cid)
SELECT
  wv.code,

  ROUND((SUM(w_loads)/SUM(weight)),0) AS loads,
  ROUND((SUM(w_mileage)/SUM(weight)),2) AS mileage,
  ROUND((SUM(w_carrier_price)/SUM(weight)),2) AS carrier_price,

  ROUND((SUM(w_profit_rate)/SUM(weight)),2) AS profit_rate,
  ROUND((SUM(w_margin)/SUM(weight)),2) AS margin
FROM

--replace null mileage with avg of the exact same lane
UPDATE
  `potrtms.regions.loads_locations` ll
SET
  miles = avg_miles
FROM (
  SELECT
    shipper_census_city,
    shipper_census_state,
    consignee_census_city,
    consignee_census_state,
    AVG(miles) AS avg_miles
  FROM
    `potrtms.regions.loads_locations`
  GROUP BY
    shipper_census_city,
    shipper_census_state,
    consignee_census_city,
    consignee_census_state) am
WHERE
  ll.shipper_census_city = am.shipper_census_city
  AND ll.shipper_census_state = am.shipper_census_state
  AND ll.consignee_census_city = am.consignee_census_city
  AND ll.consignee_census_state = am.consignee_census_state
  AND ll.miles IS NULL 
;
UPDATE
  `potrtms.regions.loads_locations`
SET
  customer_rate =((customer_price+fuel_surcharge)/miles),
  carrier_rate = (carrier_price/miles),
  profit_rate = (((customer_price+fuel_surcharge) - carrier_price)/miles)
WHERE
  TRUE 
;
 --Define density based spatial clusters over shipper and consignee data. Mininimum points per cluster = 1. Maximum distance between clusters points: 75/100km (45/60 miles)
  CREATE TEMPORARY TABLE voronoi_shipper AS (
  WITH
    shipper_clusters AS (
    SELECT
      load_id,
      shipper_geom,
      ST_CLUSTERDBSCAN(shipper_geom,
        1e5,
        1) OVER () AS cluster_num
    FROM
      `potrtms.regions.loads_locations`
    WHERE
      shipper_geom IS NOT NULL ),

    shipper_centroids AS(
    SELECT
      cluster_num,
      ARRAY_AGG(load_id) AS rowids,
      ST_Centroid(ST_UNION_AGG(shipper_geom)) AS cgeom
    FROM
      shipper_clusters
    GROUP BY
      cluster_num ),
    shipper_array_centroids AS (
    SELECT
      ARRAY (
      SELECT
        cgeom
      FROM
        shipper_centroids) AS ageom ),

    shipper_voronoi_array AS (
    SELECT
      bqcarto.processing.ST_VORONOIPOLYGONS(ageom,
        NULL) AS nested_voronoi
    FROM
      shipper_array_centroids ),
    shipper_voronoi_polygons AS (
    SELECT
      ST_INTERSECTION(aoi.geom,
        unnested_voronoi) AS vor_geom
    FROM
      shipper_voronoi_array,
      UNNEST(nested_voronoi) AS unnested_voronoi,
      `potrtms.regions.aoi` AS aoi )

  SELECT
    cluster_num,
    rowids,
    ST_AREA(vor_geom) AS area,
    vor_geom
  FROM
    shipper_voronoi_polygons
  JOIN
    shipper_centroids
  ON
    ST_Contains(vor_geom,
      cgeom) )
;

    shipper_weights w
  JOIN
    `potrtms.regions.dbscan_shipper` k
  ON
    k.cid = w.cid)

SELECT
  wv.code,
  wv.name,
  ROUND((SUM(w_loads)/SUM(weight)),0) AS loads,
  ROUND((SUM(w_mileage)/SUM(weight)),2) AS mileage,
  ROUND((SUM(w_carrier_price)/SUM(weight)),2) AS carrier_price,
  ROUND((SUM(w_customer_price)/SUM(weight)),2) AS customer_price,
  ROUND((SUM(w_carrier_rate)/SUM(weight)),2) AS carrier_rate,
  ROUND((SUM(w_customer_rate)/SUM(weight)),2) AS customer_rate,
  ROUND((SUM(w_profit_rate)/SUM(weight)),2) AS profit_rate,
  ROUND((SUM(w_margin)/SUM(weight)),2) AS margin
FROM
  shipper_weighted_values wv
JOIN
  `potrtms.regions.economic_areas` ea
ON
  wv.code = ea.code
GROUP BY
  wv.code,
  wv.name
;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS
  `potrtms.regions.wave_consignee`
;
CREATE TABLE
  `potrtms.regions.wave_consignee` AS
WITH
  consignee_weights AS (
  SELECT
    ea.code,
    ea.name,
    c.cid,
    c.loads,
    (ST_Area(ST_Intersection(c.geom,
          ea.geom)) * c.loads) AS weight
  FROM
    `potrtms.regions.economic_areas` AS ea
  INNER JOIN
    `potrtms.regions.dbscan_consignee` c
  ON
    ST_Intersects( c.geom,
      ea.geom)),

  consignee_weighted_values AS (
  SELECT
    w.code,
    w.name,
    w.cid,
    weight,
    (k.loads * w.weight) AS w_loads,
    (k.mileage * w.weight) AS w_mileage,
    (k.carrier_price * w.weight) AS w_carrier_price,
    (k.customer_price * w.weight) AS w_customer_price,
    (k.carrier_rate * w.weight) AS w_carrier_rate,
    (k.customer_rate * w.weight) AS w_customer_rate,
    (k.profit_rate * w.weight) AS w_profit_rate,
    (k.margin * w.weight) AS w_margin
  FROM
    consignee_weights w
  JOIN
    `potrtms.regions.dbscan_consignee` k
  ON
    k.cid = w.cid)
SELECT
  wv.code,
  wv.name,
  ROUND((SUM(w_loads)/SUM(weight)),0) AS loads,
  ROUND((SUM(w_mileage)/SUM(weight)),2) AS mileage,
  ROUND((SUM(w_carrier_price)/SUM(weight)),2) AS carrier_price,
  ROUND((SUM(w_customer_price)/SUM(weight)),2) AS customer_price,
  ROUND((SUM(w_carrier_rate)/SUM(weight)),2) AS carrier_rate,
  ROUND((SUM(w_customer_rate)/SUM(weight)),2) AS customer_rate,
  ROUND((SUM(w_profit_rate)/SUM(weight)),2) AS profit_rate,
  ROUND((SUM(w_margin)/SUM(weight)),2) AS margin
FROM
  consignee_weighted_values wv
JOIN
  `potrtms.regions.economic_areas` ea
ON
  wv.code = ea.code
GROUP BY
  wv.code,
  wv.name
;
ALTER TABLE
  `potrtms.regions.economic_areas` 
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    shipper_wav_loads FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    shipper_wav_mileage FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    shipper_wav_carrier_price FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    shipper_wav_customer_price FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    shipper_wav_carrier_rate FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    shipper_wav_customer_rate FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    shipper_wav_profit_rate FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    shipper_wav_margin FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    consignee_wav_loads FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    consignee_wav_mileage FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    consignee_wav_carrier_price FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    consignee_wav_customer_price FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    consignee_wav_carrier_rate FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    consignee_wav_customer_rate FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    consignee_wav_profit_rate FLOAT64,
  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    consignee_wav_margin FLOAT64
;
UPDATE
  `potrtms.regions.economic_areas` ea
SET
  shipper_wav_loads = w.loads,
  shipper_wav_mileage = w.mileage,
  shipper_wav_carrier_price = w.carrier_price,
  shipper_wav_customer_price = w.customer_price,
  shipper_wav_carrier_rate = w.carrier_rate,
  shipper_wav_customer_rate = w.customer_rate,
  shipper_wav_profit_rate = w.profit_rate,
  shipper_wav_margin = w.margin
FROM
  `potrtms.regions.wave_shipper` w
WHERE
  ea.code = w.code
;
UPDATE
  `potrtms.regions.economic_areas` ea
SET
  consignee_wav_loads = w.loads,
  consignee_wav_mileage = w.mileage,
  consignee_wav_carrier_price = w.carrier_price,
  consignee_wav_customer_price = w.customer_price,
  consignee_wav_carrier_rate = w.carrier_rate,
  consignee_wav_customer_rate = w.customer_rate,
  consignee_wav_profit_rate = w.profit_rate,
  consignee_wav_margin = w.margin
FROM
  `potrtms.regions.wave_consignee` w
WHERE
  ea.code = w.code
;
ALTER TABLE

  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS

  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS

  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS

  ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS 
    consignee_wav_profit_rate FLOAT64,

UPDATE

model.Exo_analytics.feat_eng_loads.raw_sql:
WITH loads_locations AS (
  SELECT 
    equipment_category,
    booked_at,
    carrier_price,
    customer_price,
    fuel_surcharge,
    mileage,
    shp_geom,
    csg_geom
  FROM
    {{ ref('fct_loads') }} 
)

SELECT
  equipment_category,
  CAST(EXTRACT(dayofweek FROM booked_at) AS STRING) AS dayofweek,
  CAST(EXTRACT(month FROM booked_at) AS STRING) AS month,
  mileage,
  ST_GeoHash(shp_geom,6) shp_geohash,
  ST_GeoHash(csg_geom,6) csg_geohash,
  (customer_price+fuel_surcharge) AS final_price
FROM
  loads_locations
WHERE
  mileage IS NOT NULL
  AND customer_price IS NOT NULL
  AND carrier_price IS NOT NULL
model.Exo_analytics.feat_eng_loads.name: feat_eng_loads
model.Exo_analytics.feat_eng_loads.description: Feature engineered loads_locations analytical db for model training

equipment_cat.name: equipment_cat
equipment_cat.description:
Equipment category grouped by one of the following equipment types:

|Category              |Equipment types                                             |
|----------------------|------------------------------------------------------------|
|Open Deck Specialized |'Removable Gooseneck' or 'Double Drop'                      |
|Van                   |'Van', 'Van or Reefer' or 'Flatbed Step Deck or Van'        |
|Reefer                |'Reefer'                                                    |
|Open Deck             |'Flatbed', 'Conestoga', 'Step Deck', 'Flatbed or Step Deck' |
|Power Only            |'Power Only'                                                |

dayofweek.name: dayofweek
dayofweek.description: Day of week extracted from booked_date (1=Sunday, 7= Saturday)

mileage.name: mileage
mileage.description: road distance between origin and destination in miles

shp_geohash.name: shp_geohash
shp_geohash.description: Shipper lat lon point converted to geohash

csg_geohash.name: csg_geohash
csg_geohash.description: Consignee lat lon point converted to geohash

source.Exo_analytics.tms.loads.name: loads
source.Exo_analytics.tms.loads.source_description: This is a replica of the Postgres database used by our tms app
source.Exo_analytics.tms.loads.description: One record per load transacted. Includes archived loads.

id.name: id
id.description: Primary key in database, also serves as our load number

pickup_date.name: pickup_date
pickup_date.description: Date that the load picks up

delivery_date.name: delivery_date
delivery_date.description: Date of final delivery after any stops

po_number.name: po_number
po_number.description: Purchase order number, used by our customers

pu_number.name: pu_number
pu_number.description: Pickup number, driver gives this number to the shipper when they arrive

date_created.name: date_created
date_created.description: Primary created date in the database

shipper_pickup_number.name: shipper_pickup_number
shipper_pickup_number.description: Pickup number when they arrive at the shipper. Duplicate of pu_number, we just never removed, sometimes it's used sometimes not, old field prob should be gone

consignee_delivery_number.name: consignee_delivery_number
consignee_delivery_number.description: Delivery number for the consignee (a driver gives this to the delivery location so they know what is being delivered)

carrier_price.name: carrier_price
carrier_price.description: Line haul price paid to the carrier

customer_price.name: customer_price
customer_price.description: Line haul price charged to the customer

fuel_surcharge.name: fuel_surcharge
fuel_surcharge.description: Fee billed to the customer sometimes to account for variations in fuel costs

accessorial.name: accessorial
accessorial.description: This is any extra fees charged by the carrier to us.

pieces.name: pieces
pieces.description: How many pieces are on this load (eg 22 pallets)

miles.name: miles
miles.description: Total road distance between origin and destination in miles including all stops

temperature.name: temperature
temperature.description: This is used for reefer loads, if the customer requires the inside of the trailer to be a certain temperature (frozen food)

load_status.name: load_status
load_status.description: Status of a load see the screenshot for the definitons

carrier_id.name: carrier_id
carrier_id.description: Primary key of carrier in our database

consignee_id.name: consignee_id
consignee_id.description: Primary key of the destination (consignee) location

customer_company_id.name: customer_company_id
customer_company_id.description: Primary key of customer in our database

booked_date.name: booked_date
booked_date.description: Whenever we assign or change a carrier this timestamp gets recorded

confirmed_date.name: confirmed_date
confirmed_date.description: When a load moves to CONFIRMED status, record timestamp

delivered_date.name: delivered_date
delivered_date.description: When a load is delivered record a timestamp

paid_date.name: paid_date
paid_date.description: When a carrier is paid, record a timestamp

picked_date.name: picked_date
picked_date.description: When a load is picked up by the carrier

invoiced_date.name: invoiced_date
invoiced_date.description: When load is invoiced to the customer

is_paid.name: is_paid
is_paid.description: Boolean, true when a carrier is paid

is_invoiced.name: is_invoiced
is_invoiced.description: Boolean, true when a customer is invoiced

carrier_max_buy.name: carrier_max_buy
carrier_max_buy.description: The max that we would like to pay a carrier, this is used to show our carrier sales reps the max that they can book a carrier for.

carrier_start_buy.name: carrier_start_buy
carrier_start_buy.description: This is the price that we post the load out to external loadboards

delivery_early_time.name: delivery_early_time
delivery_early_time.description: Consignee early time (think of "open time" or earliest they can deliver)

delivery_late_time.name: delivery_late_time
delivery_late_time.description: Consignee late time (latest that the carrier can deliver to this location)

order_type.name: order_type
order_type.description: Type of order, this illustrates how a load originates in the system. Once a load is "good to book with a carrier" or is getting booked it will move to ACCEPTED_TENDER

pickup_early_time.name: pickup_early_time
pickup_early_time.description: Earliest time a load can be picked at a shipper

pickup_late_time.name: pickup_late_time
pickup_late_time.description: Latest time a load can be picked by a shipper

equipment_metadata.name: equipment_metadata
equipment_metadata.description: Anything special about the equipment, like "ramps" or "tarps"

agent_company_id.name: agent_company_id
agent_company_id.description: Agent company is Exo Freight, we do this in case the TMS got used for a "second company"

archived.name: archived
archived.description: This is like "deleted" but we don't delete

hash.name: hash
hash.description: Surrogate key. A hash from all the attributes of a load. This allows us to check if a load is changed by checking the hash

updated_at.name: updated_at
updated_at.description: When the load was last updated. We manage this manually and only record in specific instances

commodity.name: commodity
commodity.description: Commody of the freight, text field

assigned_at.name: assigned_at
assigned_at.description: When was a carrier assigned to the load

carrier_sales_rep_id.name: carrier_sales_rep_id
carrier_sales_rep_id.description: Primary key of an "agent" which is an internal user

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.description: JSON field that we stuff key/values into that aren't important enough for a full attribute

loadboard.name: loadboard
loadboard.description: Boolean, true if load is posted to external loadboards or not (DAT/Truckstop)

carrier_invoice_number.name: carrier_invoice_number
carrier_invoice_number.description: Records the invoice from a carrier that we pay against

is_received.name: is_received
is_received.description: Boolean, true if customer paid us

commission_at.name: commission_at
commission_at.description: When was a commission for our sales rep generated

commission_generated.name: commission_generated
commission_generated.description: Boolean, true if commission is generated

create_method.name: create_method
create_method.description: The way the load entered into our system

macro.dbt_bigquery.bigquery__get_catalog.macro_sql:
{% macro bigquery__get_catalog(information_schema, schemas) -%}

  {%- if (schemas | length) == 0 -%}
    {# Hopefully nothing cares about the columns we return when there are no rows #}
    {%- set query  = "select 1 as id limit 0" -%}
  {%- else -%}

  {%- set query -%}
    with tables as (
        select
            project_id as table_database,
            dataset_id as table_schema,
            table_id as original_table_name,

            concat(project_id, '.', dataset_id, '.', table_id) as relation_id,

            row_count,
            size_bytes as size_bytes,
            case
                when type = 1 then 'table'
                when type = 2 then 'view'
                else 'external'
            end as table_type,

            REGEXP_CONTAINS(table_id, '^.+[0-9]{8}$') and coalesce(type, 0) = 1 as is_date_shard,
            REGEXP_EXTRACT(table_id, '^(.+)[0-9]{8}$') as shard_base_name,
            REGEXP_EXTRACT(table_id, '^.+([0-9]{8})$') as shard_name

        from {{ information_schema.replace(information_schema_view='__TABLES__') }}
        where (
          {%- for schema in schemas -%}
            upper(dataset_id) = upper('{{ schema }}'){%- if not loop.last %} or {% endif -%}
          {%- endfor -%}
        )
    ),

    extracted as (

        select *,
            case
                when is_date_shard then shard_base_name
                else original_table_name
            end as table_name

        from tables

    ),

    unsharded_tables as (

        select
            table_database,
            table_schema,
            table_name,
            coalesce(table_type, 'external') as table_type,
            is_date_shard,

            struct(
                min(shard_name) as shard_min,
                max(shard_name) as shard_max,
                count(*) as shard_count
            ) as table_shards,

            sum(size_bytes) as size_bytes,
            sum(row_count) as row_count,

            max(relation_id) as relation_id

        from extracted
        group by 1,2,3,4,5

    ),

    info_schema_columns as (

        select
            concat(table_catalog, '.', table_schema, '.', table_name) as relation_id,
            table_catalog as table_database,
            table_schema,
            table_name,

            -- use the "real" column name from the paths query below
            column_name as base_column_name,
            ordinal_position as column_index,

            is_partitioning_column,
            clustering_ordinal_position

        from {{ information_schema.replace(information_schema_view='COLUMNS') }}
        where ordinal_position is not null

    ),

    info_schema_column_paths as (

        select
            concat(table_catalog, '.', table_schema, '.', table_name) as relation_id,
            field_path as column_name,
            data_type as column_type,
            column_name as base_column_name,
            description as column_comment

        from {{ information_schema.replace(information_schema_view='COLUMN_FIELD_PATHS') }}

    ),

    columns as (

        select * except (base_column_name)
        from info_schema_columns
        join info_schema_column_paths using (relation_id, base_column_name)

    ),

    column_stats as (

        select
            table_database,
            table_schema,
            table_name,
            max(relation_id) as relation_id,
            max(case when is_partitioning_column = 'YES' then 1 else 0 end) = 1 as is_partitioned,
            max(case when is_partitioning_column = 'YES' then column_name else null end) as partition_column,
            max(case when clustering_ordinal_position is not null then 1 else 0 end) = 1 as is_clustered,
            array_to_string(
                array_agg(
                    case
                        when clustering_ordinal_position is not null then column_name
                        else null
                    end ignore nulls
                    order by clustering_ordinal_position
                ), ', '
            ) as clustering_columns

        from columns
        group by 1,2,3

    )

    select
        unsharded_tables.table_database,
        unsharded_tables.table_schema,
        case
            when is_date_shard then concat(unsharded_tables.table_name, '*')
            else unsharded_tables.table_name
        end as table_name,
        unsharded_tables.table_type,

        -- coalesce name and type for External tables - these columns are not
        -- present in the COLUMN_FIELD_PATHS resultset
        coalesce(columns.column_name, '<unknown>') as column_name,
        -- invent a row number to account for nested fields -- BQ does
        -- not treat these nested properties as independent fields
        row_number() over (
            partition by relation_id
            order by columns.column_index, columns.column_name
        ) as column_index,
        coalesce(columns.column_type, '<unknown>') as column_type,
        columns.column_comment,

        'Shard count' as `stats__date_shards__label`,
        table_shards.shard_count as `stats__date_shards__value`,
        'The number of date shards in this table' as `stats__date_shards__description`,
        is_date_shard as `stats__date_shards__include`,

        'Shard (min)' as `stats__date_shard_min__label`,
        table_shards.shard_min as `stats__date_shard_min__value`,
        'The first date shard in this table' as `stats__date_shard_min__description`,
        is_date_shard as `stats__date_shard_min__include`,

        'Shard (max)' as `stats__date_shard_max__label`,
        table_shards.shard_max as `stats__date_shard_max__value`,
        'The last date shard in this table' as `stats__date_shard_max__description`,
        is_date_shard as `stats__date_shard_max__include`,

        '# Rows' as `stats__num_rows__label`,
        row_count as `stats__num_rows__value`,
        'Approximate count of rows in this table' as `stats__num_rows__description`,
        (unsharded_tables.table_type = 'table') as `stats__num_rows__include`,

        'Approximate Size' as `stats__num_bytes__label`,
        size_bytes as `stats__num_bytes__value`,
        'Approximate size of table as reported by BigQuery' as `stats__num_bytes__description`,
        (unsharded_tables.table_type = 'table') as `stats__num_bytes__include`,

        'Partitioned By' as `stats__partitioning_type__label`,
        partition_column as `stats__partitioning_type__value`,
        'The partitioning column for this table' as `stats__partitioning_type__description`,
        is_partitioned as `stats__partitioning_type__include`,

        'Clustered By' as `stats__clustering_fields__label`,
        clustering_columns as `stats__clustering_fields__value`,
        'The clustering columns for this table' as `stats__clustering_fields__description`,
        is_clustered as `stats__clustering_fields__include`

    -- join using relation_id (an actual relation, not a shard prefix) to make
    -- sure that column metadata is picked up through the join. This will only
    -- return the column information for the "max" table in a date-sharded table set
    from unsharded_tables
    left join columns using (relation_id)
    left join column_stats using (relation_id)
  {%- endset -%}

  {%- endif -%}

  {{ return(run_query(query)) }}

{%- endmacro %}

macro.dbt.default__snapshot_merge_sql.macro_sql:
{% macro default__snapshot_merge_sql(target, source, insert_cols) -%}
    {%- set insert_cols_csv = insert_cols | join(', ') -%}

    merge into {{ target }} as DBT_INTERNAL_DEST
    using {{ source }} as DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE
    on DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_scd_id = DBT_INTERNAL_DEST.dbt_scd_id

    when matched
     and DBT_INTERNAL_DEST.dbt_valid_to is null
     and DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_change_type in ('update', 'delete')
        then update
        set dbt_valid_to = DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_valid_to

    when not matched
     and DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_change_type = 'insert'
        then insert ({{ insert_cols_csv }})
        values ({{ insert_cols_csv }})
    ;
{% endmacro %}

macro.dbt.snapshot_staging_table.name: snapshot_staging_table
macro.dbt.snapshot_staging_table.macro_sql:
{% macro snapshot_staging_table(strategy, source_sql, target_relation) -%}

    with snapshot_query as (

        {{ source_sql }}

    ),

    snapshotted_data as (

        select *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key

        from {{ target_relation }}
        where dbt_valid_to is null

    ),

    insertions_source_data as (

        select
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_from,
            nullif({{ strategy.updated_at }}, {{ strategy.updated_at }}) as dbt_valid_to,
            {{ strategy.scd_id }} as dbt_scd_id

        from snapshot_query
    ),

    updates_source_data as (

        select
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_from,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_to

        from snapshot_query
    ),

    {%- if strategy.invalidate_hard_deletes %}

    deletes_source_data as (

        select 
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key
        from snapshot_query
    ),
    {% endif %}

    insertions as (

        select
            'insert' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*

        from insertions_source_data as source_data
        left outer join snapshotted_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key is null
           or (
                snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key is not null
            and (
                {{ strategy.row_changed }}
            )
        )

    ),

    updates as (

        select
            'update' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*,
            snapshotted_data.dbt_scd_id

        from updates_source_data as source_data
        join snapshotted_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where (
            {{ strategy.row_changed }}
        )
    )

    {%- if strategy.invalidate_hard_deletes -%}
    ,

    deletes as (
    
        select
            'delete' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*,
            {{ snapshot_get_time() }} as dbt_valid_from,
            {{ snapshot_get_time() }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ snapshot_get_time() }} as dbt_valid_to,
            snapshotted_data.dbt_scd_id
    
        from snapshotted_data
        left join deletes_source_data as source_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where source_data.dbt_unique_key is null
    )
    {%- endif %}

    select * from insertions
    union all
    select * from updates
    {%- if strategy.invalidate_hard_deletes %}
    union all
    select * from deletes
    {%- endif %}

{%- endmacro %}

    feature_info: &default_feature_info ['*']

    training_info: *default_training_info
    feature_info: *default_feature_info
    weights: ['*']

    training_info: *default_training_info
    feature_info: *default_feature_info
    weights: ['*']

boosted_tree_regressor: *default
dnn_classifier: *default
dnn_regressor: *default

    training_info:
        - training_run
        - iteration
        - loss
        - cast(null as float64) as eval_loss
        - cast(null as float64) as learning_rate
        - duration_ms
        - cluster_info
    feature_info: *default_feature_info
arima:
    training_info:
        - training_run
        - iteration
        - cast(null as float64) as loss
        - cast(null as float64) as eval_loss
        - cast(null as float64) as learning_rate
        - duration_ms
        - array(select as struct null as centroid_id, cast(null as float64) as cluster_radius, null as cluster_size)
    feature_info: *default_feature_info
linear_reg:
    training_info: *default_training_info
    feature_info: *default_feature_info
    weights: ['*']
logistic_reg:
    training_info: *default_training_info
    feature_info: *default_feature_info
    weights: ['*']
matrix_factorization: *default
tensorflow: {}

{%- endset -%}

{% do return(fromyaml(schemas)) %}

        select distinct

            table_name as "table_name",
            case table_type
                when 'BASE TABLE' then 'table'

        from {{ database }}.information_schema.tables
        where table_schema ilike '{{ schema_pattern }}'
        and table_name ilike '{{ table_pattern }}'
        and table_name not ilike '{{ exclude }}'

Exo_analytics.__overview__.name: __overview__
Exo_analytics.__overview__.block_contents:
### Welcome!

Welcome to the documentation for Exo-analytics dbt project!

**Check out the repo for this project [here](https://github.com/power-only-transit/Exo-analytics/).**
### Navigation

You can use the `Project` and `Database` navigation tabs on the left side of the window to explore the models in the project.

#### Project Tab

The `Project` tab mirrors the directory structure of the dbt project. In this tab, you can see all of the models defined in the dbt project, as well as models imported from dbt packages.

#### Database Tab

The `Database` tab also exposes the models, but in a format that looks more like a database explorer. This view shows relations (tables and views) grouped into database schemas. Note that ephemeral models are not shown in this interface, as they do not exist in the database.

### Graph Exploration

You can click the blue icon on the bottom-right corner of the page to view the lineage graph of the models.

On model pages, you'll see the immediate parents and children of the model you're exploring. By clicking the `Expand` button at the top-right of this lineage pane, you'll be able to see all of the models that are used to build, or are built from, the model you're exploring.

Once expanded, you'll be able to use the `--models` and `--exclude` model selection syntax to filter the models in the graph. For more information on model selection, check out the [dbt docs](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/model-selection-syntax).

Note that you can also right-click on models to interactively filter and explore the graph.

* * * * *

### More information

-   [What is dbt](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/overview)?
-   Read the [dbt viewpoint](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/viewpoint)
-   [Installation](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/installation)
-   Join the [chat](https://community.getdbt.com/) on Slack for live questions and support.

Exo_analytics.equipment_cat.name: equipment_cat
Exo_analytics.equipment_cat.block_contents:
Equipment category grouped by one of the following equipment types:

|Category              |Equipment types                                             |
|----------------------|------------------------------------------------------------|
|Open Deck Specialized |'Removable Gooseneck' or 'Double Drop'                      |
|Van                   |'Van', 'Van or Reefer' or 'Flatbed Step Deck or Van'        |
|Reefer                |'Reefer'                                                    |
|Open Deck             |'Flatbed', 'Conestoga', 'Step Deck', 'Flatbed or Step Deck' |
|Power Only            |'Power Only'                                                |

dbt.__overview__.name: __overview__
dbt.__overview__.block_contents:
### Welcome!

Welcome to the auto-generated documentation for your dbt project!

### Navigation

You can use the `Project` and `Database` navigation tabs on the left side of the window to explore the models
in your project.

#### Project Tab
The `Project` tab mirrors the directory structure of your dbt project. In this tab, you can see all of the
models defined in your dbt project, as well as models imported from dbt packages.

#### Database Tab
The `Database` tab also exposes your models, but in a format that looks more like a database explorer. This view
shows relations (tables and views) grouped into database schemas. Note that ephemeral models are _not_ shown
in this interface, as they do not exist in the database.

### Graph Exploration
You can click the blue icon on the bottom-right corner of the page to view the lineage graph of your models.

On model pages, you'll see the immediate parents and children of the model you're exploring. By clicking the `Expand`
button at the top-right of this lineage pane, you'll be able to see all of the models that are used to build,
or are built from, the model you're exploring.

Once expanded, you'll be able to use the `--models` and `--exclude` model selection syntax to filter the
models in the graph. For more information on model selection, check out the [dbt docs](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/model-selection-syntax).

Note that you can also right-click on models to interactively filter and explore the graph.

---

### More information

- [What is dbt](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/overview)?
- Read the [dbt viewpoint](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/viewpoint)
- [Installation](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/installation)
- Join the [chat](https://community.getdbt.com/) on Slack for live questions and support.
